      • checkId

        void checkId​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles ID check action. Validates the ID field and performs necessary validation and state updates based on ID existence and validity.
        Parameters:
        event - the action event triggering this method.

      • register

        void register​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the registration action. Validates form data and interacts with the RegistrationController to convert an existing system user to a group guide.
        Parameters:
        event - the action event triggering this method.

      • paneClicked

        Navigates back to the previous screen.
        Parameters:
        event - the action event triggering this method.
        Throws:
        ScreenException - if there is an issue navigating back.
        StatefulException - if there is a state management issue during navigation.

      • hideAllExceptIDAndCheckID

        private void hideAllExceptIDAndCheckID()
        Hides all fields except for the ID field and the check ID button, making them disabled

      • loadUserDetails

        private void loadUserDetails​(SystemUser user)
        Loads guides details into the registration form fields. Intended for use when a user ID is found and their details are to be converted into a group guide registration.
        Parameters:
        user - the systemUser's object of the group guide

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the screen state and sets up initial UI elements.

      • handleCloseRequest

        public void handleCloseRequest​(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
        Description copied from class: AbstractScreen
        This method is activated after the X is clicked on the window. The default is to show a Confirmation Alert with "Yes" and "No" options for the user to choose. "Yes" will check if the client is connected to the server, disconnect it if necessary and close the window. "No" will "consume" the request, meaning it will cancel the closing request and will keep the window open. This method can be overriden for different implementations.
        Overrides:
        handleCloseRequest in class AbstractScreen
        Parameters:
        event - the event of clicking on the X of the window

      • loadBefore

        public void loadBefore​(java.lang.Object information)
        Description copied from class: AbstractScreen
        This method is called if a screen has to get information before it is shown.
        Specified by:
        loadBefore in class AbstractScreen
        Parameters:
        information - an object with the specific information for the screen
